Plugins.Admin.Debitoor.AdminInstruction:
Step by step set up guide to connect your store with Debitoor:

  • Sign-up at Debitoor for free and register an app under Settings > Account > Developer > Register.
  • Enter an app name (e.g. the name of your store) and the callback URL (s. below on this page).
  • After clicking Register the Client-ID and Client Secret are shown in the right panel. Enter them below on this page and save them.
  • Now click Create Debitoor Token. After a short time the token should be displayed in its field.
  • Execute Refresh and save data to load Debitoor configuration data.
  • Check the option Is active and save your configuration. Your store is now able to exchange data with Debitoor.

If you should later delete your Debitoor account (and thus all your Debitoor data), then please run Delete data and mappings further below. This will ensure that no unnecessary data will remain in the database.
Make sure that the configuration does not mismatch your Debitoor settings (e.g. the price type), otherwise you will get error messages of type "malformed".

Plugins.Admin.TinyImage.Compress.Title: Compression
Plugins.Admin.TinyImage.CompressFormatIn: If you disable all formats, no compression will occur regardless of other settings.
Plugins.Admin.TinyImage.CompressInfo:
TinyImage applies smart compression techniques to images to reduce their file size by up to 80 %
      Note, however, that this will slightly decrease the processing time for non-cached images.
      Also note that during compression, depending on the image, the memory usage may temporarily rise several hundred MB.
Plugins.Admin.TinyImage.CompressSuccessN: TinyImage was able to reduce the file size from {0} to {1} ( - {2}% ).
Plugins.Admin.TinyImage.CompressTimeoutN: Oops! It takes too long to compress the image. Using source image instead.
Plugins.Admin.TinyImage.Formats.Title: Formats
Plugins.Admin.TinyImage.Setting.Compress: Reduces the file size of (amimated) GIF files.
Reduces the file size of JPG files. Also generates 'progressive' JPEGs if the source file is larger than 10 KB.
Reduces the file size of PNG files by selectively decreasing the number of colors in the image.
Applies smart compression to dynamically generated thumbnails.
Applies smart compression to uploaded image files.
Plugins.Admin.TinyImage.Setting.NotifyOn: Displays a short summary about achieved compression rate after uploading images.
Plugins.Admin.TinyImage.Setting.WebPForJ: Generates and returns WebP instead of JPG files to WebP-capable browsers.
Plugins.Admin.TinyImage.Setting.WebPForP: Generates and returns WebP instead of PNG files to WebP-capable browsers.
Plugins.Admin.TinyImage.Tools.Title: Tools
Plugins.Admin.TinyImage.ToolsInfo: TinyImage uses various third-party tools in the background to compress images. Which tool is used depends on the source image format, and each tool has various options to set the compression quality or algorithm. Please refer to the vendor's documentation to learn more about these options. The TinyImage presets provide the best tradeoff between size and quality though.
Plugins.Admin.TinyImage.WebP.Info:
WebP is a relatively new format for lossless image compression and is currently supported by Chrome, Edge, Opera and Firefox as of version 65 (about 92% market share as of 2022).
      TinyImage can deliver images in WebP format to capable browser. Other browsers are provided with images in their native format (PNG or JPG).
      Depending on the image, however, it is possible that PNG and JPG files achieve better compression rates.
      Therefore, for formats that are already compressed, we recommend disabling WebP.
      However, if you prefer overall fast image processing and minimal memory usage, turn WebP on, and disable PNG and JPG compression.
Plugins.Admin.TinyImage.WebP.Title: WebP

Plugins.Misc.MailChimp.AdminInstruction:
This Plugin synchronizes your newsletter subscribers directly with your MailChimp lists.

  1. Enter your MailChimp API-Key. More Information about the API-Key can be found here:
    http://kb.mailchimp.com/article/where-can-i-find-my-api-key
  2. Choose the MailChimp list with which you want to synchronize the data from your shop
  3. Import all Newsletter-Subscribers for the first time. (Important: This procedure should only be executed once)
  4. Decide whether to synchronize automatically or manual
    a) automatically: Active the appropriate option
    b) manual: Click the button manual Synchronization whenever the synchronization should be executed
  5. Enter your WebHooks-Key to get informed about the unsubscribe event from MAilChimp. Further information about WebHooks can be found here
    https://mailchimp.com/developer/transactional/guides/track-respond-activity-webhooks/#create-a-new-webhook
Plugins.Misc.MailChimp.AutoSyncRestart: If sync task period has been changed, please restart the application

Plugins.OutputCache.AdminInstruction: For advanced users only! The bottom grid lists all routes to cacheable pages and view components. Syntax for pages is [plugin/]controller/action, and for components: vc:[plugin/]ComponentShortName. Component output is only cached as part of the page output if its route is also explicitly specified. Otherwise, the component is executed for each request, even when the parent output has been served from the cache ("Donut Hole Caching"). Components are only cached if the parent page is also cached. To clear all cache items for a particular route, click Invalidate in the corresponding action dropdown.
Plugins.OutputCache.AdminInstruction.Inv: Enter a comma-separated list of tags, whose cached items should be deleted from the cache store. A tag is made up of a prefix and an entity id, e.g. 'p1234' for a product entity with the id 1234 (other prefixes are: c = category, m = manufacturer, b = blog, n = news, t = topic). Invalidating by tag p1234 actually means: "Delete all cached pages in which the product with id 1234 gets somehow displayed".
Plugins.OutputCache.AutomaticInvalidatio: Specifies whether cache entries should be removed automatically when their dependencies change (dependencies are data entities like product, category, blog post etc.). This is highly recommended as this will update your cache instantly, if e.g. the price of a product changes.
Plugins.OutputCache.CacheAuthenticatedRe: Specifies whether caching will apply even if the user is authenticated. Beware though that cached pages are only varied by customer roles, not by specific customers. Uncheck this option if your shop generates customer specific content.

Plugins.Payments.IonosPayment.AdminInstr:
Steps to configure ipayment:

  1. Log into your ipayment account.
  2. The overview shows you the data account ID, application ID, application password and transaction password. Enter them below on this page.
  3. Click applications, select your application\store and click edit.
  4. There please note the following settings and don't forget to save:
    • Deactivate force to enter address
    • Leave hidden trigger url empty (transmitted by store)
    • Enter any transaction security key and enter it below on this page too
    • Deactivate address checking

Steps to configure Klarna "Pay Now":

  1. Log in here or register.
  2. Click on New project and then on Create project. Choose the type Gateway Project.
  3. Enter required data, activate the payment method Pay Now and leave success, abort and timeout link and HTTP notification empty.

Plugins.SmartStore.Azure.AdminInstructio:
Azure BLOB Storage is a cloud service provided by Microsoft where you can store unstructured data as objects or blobs in the cloud. You can store all kinds of text or binary data e.g. a document or a media file. With the Azure plugin in Smartstore the Azure BLOB storage will be used as the storage for media files.

The benefits of Azure Blob Storage are:

  • Nearly unlimited capacity
  • Fully scalable
  • Only used storage has to be payed
  • Better global and local access times due to geo-redundancy

Creation of a Blob-Storage account

  • Sign in or register for the Azure portal (portal.azure.com)
  • Navigate to New > Storage > Storage account
  • Enter a name for your storage account
  • Choose your preferred deployment model (Resource Manager is the recommended deployment model.)
  • Choose your storage type: General or Blob Storage. Choose the setting Blob Storage.
  • Choose the access rate: Hot Data
  • The encryption setting can be configured according to your preferences. We recommend to turn both settings off.

Setting up your storage account in Smartstore

  • Open the Azure portal and navigate to your storage account
  • Click on access keys to display your account access keys
  • The tab access keys contains preconfigured connection strings from where you can copy one
  • Now, navigate to the Smartstore shop directory and open the file appsettings.json with a text editor
  • Activate the configuration node with the name Smartstore.Azure.BlobStorage by removing the comments
  • Replace the example connection string with the copied one from the Azure portal
  • Save the file
  • Restart your shop

Plugins.SmartStore.cXmlPunchout.AdminIns:
This plugin offers the possibility to connect your product catalog to the Ariba SAP system.

To set up a customer to use the plugin, follow these instructions:

  • Navigate to the customer in the administration area of your store and enter a user name and a shared secret in the tab cXmlPunchout.
  • Inform the customer about this data so that he can store it in his caller system.
  • Tell the customer the Setup-Url, which he also has to store in his system. You will find an example of this below.
  • Now the customer can navigate from his system to your store and transfer his assembled shopping cart back to his system with one click from the shopping cart of your store.

Setup-URL: https://www.meinshop.de/Plugins/cXmlPunchout/PunchoutSetup

The setup URL is the entry point, which is used for communication between the store and the caller system.

Index catalog URL: https://www.meinshop.de/Plugins/cXmlPunchout/PunchoutIndexCatalog

PunchOut index catalogs are files that link to the supplier's PunchOut website.

Important notice: As the shop website will called in an iFrame it's important to change the SameSite-setting to None Configuration > Settings > Customers > Privacy > SameSite mode The param requireSSL of the node authentication/forms in the web.config must be set to true in production mode in order to apply this setting when creating the authentication cookie. Also the widget must be activated at CMS > Widgets in order to show the button to transfer the basket on the basket page.
Plugins.SmartStore.cXmlPunchout.Customer: Specify here whether the use of cXMLPunchout is approved for this customer.
This value is set automatically during authentication. Change it only if you want to force the authentication again.
Enter here the shared secret of the customer, with which he must authenticate himself when using cXmlPunchout.
Enter here the username of the customer, with which he must authenticate himself when using cXmlPunchout.

Enter your Supplier Part ID here. This value can also be freely selected by the store operator and serves to identify your catalog.

Plugins.SmartStore.DependingPrices.Admin:
To configure this plugin navigate to the respective product for which you want to define prices based on customer roles and define the prices in the tab group prices.

Product Groups

By managing your prices via product groups, you can save a lot of configuration effort. Enter the prices for a product group here and define only the corresponding item group ID at product level.

Import

To import records for this plugin, do a normal import Admin > Configuration > Import. Select the ID field as the key field. The file to be imported must contain the following fields
ID, DP_ItemGroupId, DP_CustomerGroupId, DP_LanguageId, DP_StoreId, DP_CustomerNumber, DP_Price, DP_CalculationMethod

Plugins.Smartstore.DirectOrder.AdminInst:
This plugin allows you to integrate a direct order form into your shop. Your customers can enter a SKU and the quantity of units they want to order and add the products to the cart with one single click. This is useful in B2B scenarios, where customers know the SKUs of the products they want to buy and don't like visiting every single product page to compose a cart.

To add a link to the order form to a menu, select Add link to menu / Route from the respective menu and enter DirectOrderForm as the name of the route and an arbitrary title.
Plugins.Smartstore.DirectOrder.CSVUpload: You can upload a CSV file in the following field. The file must end in *.csv or *.xlsx and must include the columns "DO_Sku" and "DO_Quantity". Here you can download a sample.

Plugins.SmartStore.GeoBlocker.CountryRes: Select restriction type for countries (Allow = Opt-in, Deny = Opt-out).
Plugins.SmartStore.GeoBlocker.IgnoreRegi: Defines whether registered users are granted access without validation.
Plugins.SmartStore.GeoBlocker.IpAddresse:
To explicitly block or allow IP addresses you need to enter desired addresses into the text area. Only one address per line. Allowed are IPv4 addresses with wildcard placeholder. * represents any number and ? any digit. IPv4 addresses consist of 4 blocks with each one byte (number range from 0 to 255). Each block is separated by a period. You can also define IP addresses with number ranges.
Valid IP addresses are, for example:
  • 123.123.123.123
  • 1.2.3.4
  • 123.??.*.?
  • 11-200.33-40.*.???
Plugins.SmartStore.GeoBlocker.IpRanges.H: Enter IP addresses as IPv4. IPv4 addresses consist of 4 blocks with each one bytes (number from 0 to 255). Only one rule per line!
Plugins.SmartStore.GeoBlocker.IpRestrict: Select restriction type for IP addresses.
Plugins.SmartStore.GeoBlocker.IsActive.H: Specify whether the GEO Blocker is enabled.
Plugins.SmartStore.GeoBlocker.Restrictio: Defines the type of restriction by which shop visitors are filtered. You can choose between Allow (Opt-in) and Deny (Opt-out). If the restriction type is set to Allow, you must explicitly grant access for countries and addresses. Any other requests will be denied. If Deny is selected as restriction type, you can explicitly forbid access to the shop for countries and addresses. Any other requests are granted access to the shop. IP addresses have precedence over countries, thereby you can allow IP addresses from blocked countries or deny IP addresses from allowed countries.

Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.Abbreviati: Specifies abbreviations (like inch, oz) to get more search hits. Search phrases with and without space characters will be found.
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.AdminInstr: General search settings can be specified under Settings > Search.
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.AdvancedTe: These settings control how the searched texts are processed internally during indexing and search. Changes for text analysis are only effective after index rebuild!
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.AlwaysRebu: Specifies whether to always rebuild the search index rather than updating it.
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.Attributes: Changes to the settings for attributes will take effect after a full index rebuild!
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.AutomaticP: Specifies whether to observe data changes in order to update index documents at the next indexing.
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.BoostNote: Boost fields to influence the order of search hits. A higher value joins a hit earlier in the list of search hits if there is a match in the field.
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.BuildIndex: Could not build search index, because it is already in use.
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.CollectorN: A collector for indexing scope '{0}' does not exist.
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.ContinueRe: Continues a reindexing at the point where it was last aborted.
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.DefaultAna: Specifies which text analysis to use. "Automatic (language specific processing)" is recommended. For some fields, such as SKU and Product Tag, an analysis appropriate to that field is predefined. This setting is only effective for the catalog index.
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.DeleteInde: Could not delete search index, because it is already in use.
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.EnableBoos: Enables or disables boost of certain search fields.
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.EnableSpec: Specifies whether to enable filters for specification attributes. This setting only takes effect after installing the 'MegaSearchPlus' plugin.
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.EnableVari: Specifies whether to enable filters for product variant attributes. This setting only takes effect after installing the 'MegaSearchPlus' plugin.
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.HitsContai: Specifies whether search hits must contain all searched terms (logical AND operation). The more terms are entered, the fewer search hits are returned. This option is especially interesting for very large amounts of data and many search hits. However, it can slow down the attribute facets.
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.IgnoreAttr: Specifies whether to ignore "Allow filtering" on product level. This can speed up attribute facets.
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.IndentCate: Specifies whether to indent category filters.
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.IndexNotEx: The search index does not exist.
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.IndexNotMo: Index was not modified. Reason: no items to process.
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.IndexRebui: Changes will take effect after a full index rebuild.
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.IsAdvanced: Specifies whether to enable the advanced text analysis.
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.IsSpellChe: Specifies whether to display suggestions with similar terms for the entered search phrase under "Did you mean" or "Related search terms".
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.IsTopCateg: Specifies whether to display suggestions for categories for the entered search phrase.
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.IsTopManuf: Specifies whether to display suggestions for manufacturers/brands for the entered search phrase.
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.MaxIndexed: Specifies the maximum number of indexed suggestions. 0 means that all suggestions are indexed.
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.MaxTopCate: Specifies the maximum number of category suggestions.
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.MaxTopManu: Specifies the maximum number of manufacturer/brand suggestions.
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.MinTermLen: Specifies the minimum length of words to be considered (so called terms). "2" is the recommended value. Words with a shorter length are ignored. An increased value drastically reduces the number of search hits.
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.MustRebuil: Performing index rebuild, although an update was requested. Reason: index '{0}' has not been updated for too long.
Performing index rebuild, although an update was requested. Reason: some global settings have changed since last indexing.
Performing index rebuild, although an update was requested. Reason: too many changes that affect the index '{0}'.
Performing index rebuild, although an update was requested. Reason: index '{0}' does not exist.
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.Rebuild.Hi: Rebuilds the index completely. This process can take several minutes depending on the amount of data.
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.ShowHitCou: Specifies whether to show the hit count for filters.
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.SkippingUp: Skipping index update. Reason: no items to process.
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.SpellCheck: Specifies the maximum number of product hits up to which suggestions are provided.
Specifies the maximum number of displayed suggestions.
Specifies the minimum length of a search term. For shorter terms no suggestions will be provided.
{0} suggestions at segment {1} of {2} with {3} documents
Specifies whether or not to display related search terms in a successful search.
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.SplitterCu: You can add custom words to the standard dictionary. The dictionary is necessary in order to be able to split compound words meaningfully so that all subwords are found. Enter one word per line.
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.SplitterEx: Specifies compound words to be excluded from splitting. Enter one word per line. Use the pipe character | to mark the correct place to split the word, example Techniker|kranken|kasse.
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.Synonyms.H: Allows specification of synonym groups. Enter all words of one group in one row separated by comma. Example: notebook,laptop,convertible.
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.TextAnalys: Allows you to specify a different text analysis for the product name (catalog index), as well as the subject and post text (forum index).
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.Update.Hin: Updates only those data of the index that have changed since the last indexing. Except metadata (such as categories to be faceted), which are always fully indexed.
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.WordStemme: Specifies the stemmers for creating word stems. Stemmers differ in accuracy and how certain stemming obstacles are overcome.
Plugins.SmartStore.MegaSearch.WordStemmi: Specifies words to be excluded from word stemming. Enter the words separated by comma. Example: programming,programmer,programs.
Plugins.Smartstore.Microsoft.Auth.AdminI:
How to set up Microsoft authentication:

  • Create a new app at Microsoft.
  • Specify the URL listed below as the Redirect URI.
  • From the menu on the left side select Certificates & Secrets.
  • Click the New client secret button in the tab Client Secrets.
  • Enter the value of the key in the following form as a secret client key and enter the Application ID.
Plugins.Smartstore.Microsoft.Auth.Client: Enter the value of your client secret here.
Plugins.Smartstore.Microsoft.Auth.Redire: The Redirect URI to be entered on Microsoft.

Plugins.SmartStore.Oci.AdminInstruction:
The data for the authentication of a customer is entered in the customer configuration (Admin / Customer / Customer) in the OCI tab. At least a user name and a password must be stored here. The customer must also be activated here for purchasing via OCI, by activating the setting "Is active".

The URL that must be transmitted to the cooperation partner for authentication is: http://www.mein-shop.de/Oci/Authenticate?username=xxx&password=xxx
The fields that are transferred to the calling e-procurement system are set independently by the plugin based on the current shopping cart. Below you can specify values of additional fields to be transferred for this customer. These values will override the configuration made at the plugin level.

The fields that are transferred to the calling e-procurement system are set independently by the plugin based on the current shopping cart. Subsequently, you can specify values of additional fields to be transferred. These values can be overwritten at the customer level.

Plugins.SmartStore.OfflinePayment.Descri: Enter info that will be shown to customers during checkout.
Plugins.SmartStore.OfflinePayment.Paymen: Upload an image which will be displayed as thumbnail of the payment method on the payment selection page.
By default, the incremented, numeric id for orders and customer are at the same time the order number or the customer number. This plugin helps you to create a custom number pattern that suits your business needs. Please consider that the pattern affects new orders and new registered customers only and that order numbers (once created) are immutable.
Format for date (placeholder %d) (eg: yyyyMMdd, ddMMyyyy, dd, MM etc.)
Format for order date (placeholder %d) (eg: yyyyMMdd, ddMMyyyy, dd, MM etc.)
The leading char that should be used to pad the order id.
The leading char that should be used to pad the order id.
An arbitrary string pattern that can contain the placeholders %id (numeric customer ID), %d (date) and %l (unique seo code of the customer langauge). eg: 'CN-%d-%id' results in 'CN-20131022-1248'.
An arbitrary string pattern that can contain the placeholders %id (numeric order ID), %d (order date) and %c (customer ID). eg: 'OR-%d-%id' results in 'OR-20131022-1248'.
Min. length for customer id (placeholder %id). Leading chars are prepended to the order id when it's too short (eg: 248 results in 000248 with setting 6)
Min. length for order id (placeholder %id). Leading chars are prepended to the order id when it's too short (eg: 248 results in 000248 with setting 6)

Activate this option if the hover background is dark. This transforms the colors of block content texts to white on hover.

Specifies the effect that is used to reveal the block.

Basically, the effect is triggered when the upper edge of the block hits the lower edge of the screen. This trigger point can be adjusted using a pixel offset. A negative offset is also valid. Default: 120.

Plugins.SmartStore.Payone.AdminInstructi:
Instructions to set up PAYONE:

  1. Sign up in the merchant area of PAYONE.
  2. Create a new sub account under configuration > account. Enter the sub account ID on this page below.
  3. Create a new portal under configuration > payment portal. You use your store URL and activate the channels FinanceGate Frontend and FinanceGate Server-API.
  4. Go to the Advanced tab. There enter the Transaction-Status URL listed below on this page.
  5. Enter the data displayed under API parameters on this page in the fields provided for this purpose.

Tip: You can customize the appearance of the PAYONE payment page as follows:

  1. Go to the PAYONE merchant area to configuration > account and open the Advanced tab.
  2. Select the language of the template and replace the CSS statements between the following lines
    <style type="text/css" media="screen"><!--
    and
    --></style>
  3. For example try out the following CSS: Show
form[name=paymentform] > table {
	width: 640px;
	margin: 0 auto;
	font-size: 0.9em;
}
table {
	width: 100%;
}
td {
	font-family: Arial, Helvetica, Geneva, SunSans-Regular;
	padding: 3px 0 3px 0;
}
input {
	padding: 3px 4px 2px 4px;
}
input[type=text] {
	width: 280px;
}
input[type=radio] {
	margin-right: 50px;
}
select {
	width: 292px;
	padding: 4px 0 4px 0;
}
input.short {
	width: 132px !important;
}
select.short {
	float: none !important;
	width: 144px !important;
}
input.submit {
	width: auto;
	font-weight: bold;
	color: #fff;
	padding: 6px 12px;
	background-color: #7F7B73;
	cursor: pointer;
	border: 1px solid #f0f0f0;
	border-radius: 5px 5px 5px 5px;
	-moz-border-radius: 5px 5px 5px 5px;
	-webkit-border-radius: 5px 5px 5px 5px;
}
input.submit:hover {
	background-color: #615D55;
}
input.submit[disabled] {
	color: gray;
	cursor: wait;
}
a {
	color: #000;
}
a:hover {
	color: #F79400;
}
.fullbox {
	width: 640px;
	background-color: #E3DFD7;
	padding: 0 10px 0 10px;
}
.headbox {
	width: 100%;
	font-weight: bold;
	color: white;
	background-color: #7F7B73;
	margin: 20px 0 10px 0;
	border-radius: 3px 3px 3px 3px;
	-moz-border-radius: 3px 3px 3px 3px;
	-webkit-border-radius: 3px 3px 3px 3px;
}
#submitFormBox {
	width: 100%;
}
#infoFormBox {
	width: 99%;
}
#infoFormBox td {
	font-size: 0.9em;
}
#language {
	font-size: 0.8em !important;
	width: 120px !important;
	margin-right: 3px;
}
.footer {
	height: 26px;
}
.stripline {
	border-top: 1px solid #999;
	padding-top: 5px;
}
.errortext {
	color: #c00;
}

Instructions to set up Skrill:

  1. Register now for free at Skrill.
  2. Go to Settings > Developer Settings in your Skrill account.
  3. Activate the service Automated Payment Interface (API).
  4. Enter a password for MQI/API.
  5. Create a secret word.
  6. Enter the MQI/API password and the secret word together with the email address of your Skrill account in the form below on the page. Don't forget to save.

Plugins.SmartStore.TrustedShops.Introduc:
More trust leads to more sales!

The Trusted Shops Seal of Approval is the optimal way to increase the trust of your online customers. Trust increases customers' willingness to buy from you.

Less abandoned purchases

Give your online customers a strong reason to buy proposing the Trusted Shops Buyer Protection. This additional security leads to less shopping basket abandonment.

Your Customers become Sellers

Use our retailer evaluation with integrated customer opinions as an important marketing tool to increase the trust of your customers. Display your positive evaluation at Google Shopping and increase your traffic.

Apply now!

Trusted Shops is the well-known internet Seal of Approval for online shops which also offers
                        customers a Buyer Protection. During the audit, your online shop is subjected to extensive and
                        thorough tests. This audit, consisting of over 100 individual criteria, is based on the requirements of
                        consumer protection, national and European legislation.

Plugins.Widgets.FacebookCore.AdminInstru:
Cấu hình mạng xã hội facebook, nhúng ứng dụng chat bot lên website.

Cấu hình facebook như sau:

  • Truy cập trang developers.facebook.com.
  • Vào ứng dụng của tôi copy mã Facebook AppId
  • Chọn vertion facebook [Mặc định là v3.0]
  • Copy Facebook page id.
  • Copy customer chat của facebook page.

    Để lấy PageId của trang cần thực hiện theo các bước như sau:

    • Truy cập vào FanPage của Facebook
    • Chọn cài đặt trang
    • 1. Đi tới Cài đặt trang --> Nền tảng Messenger
    • 2. Trong phần "Plugin chat với khách hàng", hãy nhấp vào nút "Thiết lập".
    • Làm các bược tiếp theo, theo yêu cầu của Facebook rồi copy đoạn mã Customer chat vào mục Mã cho box chát
  • Lưu lại.

Plugins.Widgets.GoogleAnalytics.AdminIns:
Google Analytics is a free website statistics tool from Google. It keeps track of statistics about the visitors and ecommerce conversion on your website.

Follow the next steps to enable Google Analytics integration:

  • Create a Google Analytics account and follow the wizard to add your website.
  • Copy the Google Analytics ID into the ID field below.
  • Activate the Google Analytics widget under CMS > Widgets to integrate Google Analytics into your store.

Google Analytics can analyze data from your customers even without the use of cookies. An anonymous client ID is used for this purpose. Only when a customer agrees to the use of analytical cookies in the cookie manager, cookies are also used by the Analytics script. If you also want the tag manager to become active only after the customer has agreed to the analytical cookies, please activate the Load only with consent option below.

To include the opt-out cookie in your privacy policy, use the following code: 

<a href="javascript:gaOptout()">Deactivate Google Analytics</a>
Plugins.Widgets.GoogleAnalytics.ConsentA: If you allow personalised advertising, you will receive ads from Google services that are tailored to your personal interests.
By consenting to the transmission of advertising-related user data, you authorise us to transmit a unique identifier linked to your customer account to Google.

Plugins.Widgets.StructuredData.AdminInst:
Structured Data

  • You can validate your markup with the Schema.org.
  • You can validate your markup with the Google Structured Data Testing Tool.

Plugins.Widgets.TrustedShopsCustomerProt:
To integrate the Trusted Shops Buyer Protection on your site, please enter your Trusted Shops Id below. The protection of the order via the Trusted Shops Buyer Protection will be offered to your customers automatically automatically in the Trustmark.

If you do not yet have an account with Trusted Shops register here.
Plugins.Widgets.TrustedShopsCustomerRevi:
If the customer reviews widget is activated, your customers can register to review your store and be notified by email. If they use this option, after some time they will be sent an email from Trusted Shops, in which they are requested to rate the shop and the bought products. The transfer of the customer email address is necessary for this, because the customer must receive the products before he can rate them. For this purpose, the customer is offered a checkbox on the order confirmation page, with which he is informed about this and can agree to the transfer of his data.

To include the Trusted Shops reviews on your site, you can find step-by-step instructions below:

  • Register at Trusted Shops
  • Enter your Trusted Shops ID in the assigned area below.
  • The buyer reviews will now be displayed in your store according to the following settings.
  • Decide whether your customers will have the opportunity to write a review for your store directly after completing the order.
Enable review option in order confirmation email

Specify whether a customer is able to write a review out of the order confirmation mail.
                    To determine the placement of the rating link yourself add the token %TrustedShops.CustomerReviews% to the message template OrderCompleted.CustomerNotification.
Activate review option after order completion
Specify whether a customer can review your store after completing an order.
Display product reviews on product deatil page
Specify whether product ratings should be displayed in a tab on the product detail page.
Specify whether Trusted Shops product ratings should be displayed above the price block on the product detail page.
Specify whether a store reviews widget should be displayed on your website. It will be displayed in the left column of the store, if it is available.
What our customers say about us:

I want to use Trusted Shops customer protection. I want to be informed always once after my purchases via email to review the purchased products and rate this shop. 
                    I agree that my e-mail address will be sent to Trusted Shops GmbH for this purpose.
We use Trusted Shops as an independent service provider for obtaining reviews. Trusted Shops has taken measures to ensure that the reviews are genuine. More information
